translations.translation: bombarding them with stones of hard-baked clay,
(While) you were pelting them with stones of porphyritic lava,
which smote them with stones of baked clay,
which showered them with small pebbles of clay
Which hit them with stones of baked clay,
Striking them with stones of Sijjil.
Casting against them stones of baked clay,
hurling against them stones of baked clay
Which pelted them with stones of baked clay,
which pelted them with clay stones?
They hurled upon them stones of baked clay;
pelting them with stones of shale,
Striking them with stones of baked clay.
Striking them with stones of Sijjil.
pelting them with stones of baked clay,
Throwing at them rocks of baked clay.
Striking them with stones of hard clay,
[105:4] pelting them with stones of baked clay,
(Which pelted them with) which threw on them (stones of baked clay) like baked bricks.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { تَرْمِيهِم بِحِجَارَةٍ مِّن سِجِّيلٍ } معناه مِن حَجرٍ وطِينٍ
 ويقال: السِّجيلُ: الشّديدُ
 وكانتْ تَحملُ الحِجارةَ في أظافِرَها ومناقيرِهَا
 أَكبرُهَا مثلُ الحُمصةِ
 وأصغرُهَا مثلُ العَدسةِ
 فترسلَ ذلك عَلَيهم، فتصيرَ أجوافَهم كالعَصفِ المَأكولِ: وهو وَرقُ الزَّرعِ الذي يَسقطُ عليهِ الدُودُ فتأكلَهُ ويقال: دقاقُ التِّبنِ
 ويقال: وَرقُ كُلِّ نَابتٍ

translations.translation:
And His saying, {cast them into a blazing fire of stones} means from a stone and clay.
 It is said: {As-Sijill} is the strong.
 The stone was being carried in her nails and her bracelets.
 The largest of them is like a chickpea.


The smaller one is like a lens.


{Send this to them, and their stomachs will become like eaten straw: and it is the straw of the plant which the locusts fall upon and eat, and it is said, "The locusts have eaten it."}


It is said: "The leaf of every tree is precious."

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
{ تَرْمِيهِم } يعني: الطير
 جيش أبرهة { بِحِجَارَةٍ } متخذة { مِّن سِجِّيلٍ } [الفيل: 4] وهو معرب: سنك وكل

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text: { ترميهم بحجارةٍ } صفة لطير، { من سِجّيلٍ } من طين متحجر مطبوخ مثل الآجر، قال ابن عباس: " أدركت عند أم هاني نحو قفيز من هذه الحجارة "
